duck: Omission bias - The omission bias is an alleged type of cognitive bias.

Omission (criminal law) - In the criminal law, an omission, or failure to act, will constitute an actus reus and give rise to liability only when the law imposes a duty to act and the defendant is in breach of that duty.
Mathematical proof - In mathematics, a proof is a demonstration that if some fundamental statements are assumed to be true, then some mathematical statement is necessarily true.
Argument - In logic and philosophy, an argument is an attempt to persuade someone of something, by giving reasons or evidence for accepting a particular conclusion.
Lie - To lie is to deliver a false statement to another person which the speaking person knows is not the whole truth, intentionally.
omission definition: something neglected or left undone.
